# [No Third-Party Infringement - Google Search](https://www.google.com/search?q=No+Third-Party+Infringement&num=10&newwindow=1&sca_esv=bdb61428d65a36dc&sxsrf=ANbL-n4NC-DDKZBgl6DoDE5hOYBSgMd1GQ%3A1770635371985&udm=50&fbs=ADc_l-aN0CWEZBOHjofHoaMMDiKpaEWjvZ2Py1XXV8d8KvlI3vxYI1tojT_24H7Q4iMwclSqIfnTP5J_a1_YHnhrZjiiTJD_2pug00kYgkdnJCgVeWKMtN3ZYjU-fsD1M3d2Dmx5u48V5sGy6qK2CDGNRJSr_g3Ly8SEZUYaAfN5KlOZfCQHCeGUbjQAGtFkwtOWlsXfajxZ&aep=1&ntc=1&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwizwv7iosySAxWSgv0HHRb9CocQ2J8OegQIGhAE&biw=1692&bih=1287&dpr=1&mstk=AUtExfA2EP0eZvPRFi8IG4Q9T7zctByElEZ4Mazh7jILgVpHLFpQ9_0P8Id_Jd32mHoWmZ02J8b7rVtODlMl0t-C8oXitSUFxcysX-1T0D8dpF8RbzvzqptoO3dF96JsdO-k0qq8hyAPX0Cf-2nUYCLsg5wTs0FBRx29eaDg8b2hxmrrYfBJgr0CUSXpnJ6y43UpveHn-WquPKHrC7M-g0ABYIdWoeClgKStDdyKT07ajOdNaE49rFb4TIsYdw&csuir=1&atvm=1)

> ## Excerpt
> No Third-Party Infringement

---
No Third-Party Infringement

In legal and business contexts,

**"No Third-Party Infringement"** refers to a guarantee (representation and warranty) that a product, service, or creative work does not violate the intellectual property (IP) rights of any outside person or entity.

Key Applications

*   **Contracts and Licensing:** Vendors or creators often include a "No Infringement of Third-Party IP Rights" clause to assure buyers that the deliverables—such as software, music, or designs—are original and do not breach any existing patents, copyrights, or trademarks.
*   **Employment Agreements:** Employees may be required to sign a "No Violation of Third-Party Rights" clause, promising they will not use confidential information or trade secrets from a former employer.
*   **Compliance and Risk Management:** Businesses must perform due diligence (e.g., trademark searches) before launching new products to ensure they are not infringing on third-party rights, as "ignorance is no defense" in legal disputes.
*   **Liability and Indemnification:** If an infringement occurs, the party providing the "no infringement" guarantee is typically responsible for defending the claim and paying any resulting damages or legal fees.

Common Definitions

*   **Infringement:** Any act exclusively reserved for an IP owner (like copying or selling) that is performed by a third party without consent.
*   **Third Party:** Any individual or entity that is not an original party to the contract or agreement.

Are you looking for a **specific clause** for a contract, or do you need help **checking a design** for potential infringement?

i want the first response in markdown

A

**No Third-Party Infringement** clause is a legal guarantee used in contracts to affirm that a product, service, or creative work does not violate the intellectual property (IP) rights of any outside entity.

Key Components

*   **Representation and Warranty:** The provider (seller/licensor) asserts as a fact that the deliverables are original or properly licensed.
*   **Scope of Rights:** It typically covers all major forms of IP, including **patents**, **copyrights**, **trademarks**, and **trade secrets**.
*   **Indemnification:** Often paired with an [Intellectual Property Indemnification Clause](https://fynk.com/en/clauses/intellectual-property-indemnification/), which requires the provider to defend the buyer against legal claims and pay for resulting damages.
*   **Knowledge Qualifiers:** Sellers may attempt to limit this by stating the guarantee is only "to the best of their knowledge" to avoid liability for unknown third-party patents.

Common Use Cases

1.  **Software Licensing:** Assures the licensee that the code does not contain stolen proprietary algorithms or unlicensed open-source components.
2.  **Freelance/Consultancy:** Ensures that work created by a contractor (like a logo or article) is original and that the client will not be sued for using it.
3.  **Mergers & Acquisitions:** Buyers require these warranties to ensure the assets they are purchasing are not burdened by existing or threatened IP litigation.

Difference from "No Third-Party Rights"

It is important to distinguish this from a **"No Third-Party Rights"** clause (often relating to the [Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999](https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1999/31/notes?view=plain) in the UK). While "No Infringement" protects against IP theft, a "No Third-Party Rights" clause prevents outside individuals from enforcing the terms of the contract itself.

Would you like to see a **sample template** for an IP non-infringement clause?
